page.title: 04Dialect of Cowdenbeath
page.content: The Cowdenbeath dialect has changed. Most elderly people surveyed agreed that many words have disappeared from common use in their lifetime. Some of these words are; serk {skirt}, glor {mud}, pow {head}, tyke {rascal}, wain{ {child}, pug{engine}, gravat {scarf}, tawse {belt},tim {poor}, lippy {3.5 {pounds of potatoes }, birl{spin}. { meanings in blue} The majority of elderly people felt that the dialect had become nearer the English taught in schools. American words and phrases are also much more in evidence than previously. Younger people disagree with this and feel that the dialect has not changed. They do agree, however, with the older generation in that they think a dialect is good as it is individual. In fact everyone liked the dialect.
